column2: IOWA DMV TEST
column4: Iowa

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: show which lanes you must use.
column8: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 2. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column6: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column10: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column8: A road joins from the left

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: School zone ahead

column2: 5. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: look for a detour or another route.
column6: remove the sign and move forward.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 6. Excessive speed:
column4: increases the likelihood of serious bodily injuries and death.
column6: helps you to maneuver around obstacles.
column8: saves time so you can get to your destination more quickly.

column2: 7. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: riding the pedal lightly.
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 8. Headlights are required, day or night, when visibility is less than ____ feet.
9. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: no passing zone

column2: 10. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column6: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column10: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers must turn right

column2: 13. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column4: Crossbuck

column2: 14. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column6: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column8: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column10: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.

column2: 15. To enter a freeway:
column4: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column6: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column8: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column10: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.

column2: 16. To reduce road rage, you should:
column4: talk on your cell phone while driving.
column6: always signal your intention when changing lanes.
column8: use your horn frequently to warn other drivers.

column2: 17. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column10: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.

column2: 18. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column4: protect

column2: 19. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column6: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 20. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Enter the intersection with caution.
column6: Wait for the next green light.
column8: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column10: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

column2: 21. Orange is the basic color of signs used in construction zones.
column4: False

column2: 22. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the time of day.
column8: the condition and type of vehicle tires.
column10: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.

column2: 23. When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
column4: buckled up in the back seat.
column6: in the bed of a pick-up truck.
column8: buckled up in the front seat.

column2: 24. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column8: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column10: wait until traffic ahead is clear.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 26. A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
column4: a deaf person.

column2: 27. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column6: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.

column2: 28. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column4: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.
column6: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.

column2: 29. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from the left.

column2: 30. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column4: Destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 31. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column4: Improved judgement

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column4: One-way street ahead

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn

column2: 34. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column6: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column8: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.
column10: pass slower vehicles on the right.

column2: 35. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: School ahead.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
